issue.title: [C++] Add support for non-local filesystem URIs in the Substrait consumer
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-16463](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16463). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Currently the Substrait consumer only accepts URIs that use the `file` scheme.  We should add support for URI schemes that we support (`s3`, `gcfs`) similar to the way pyarrow can create filesystems from URIs.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16463?focusedCommentId=17531842) by Ariana Villegas (ArianaVillegas):*
With non-local filesystems URIs we should add tests to different file options (file, path, directory and glob) to make sure we are handling them correctly.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16463?focusedCommentId=17607873) by @toddfarmer:*
This issue was last updated over 90 days ago, which may be an indication it is no longer being actively worked. To better reflect the current state, the issue is being unassigned per [project policy](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/dev/developers/bug_reports.html#issue-assignment). Please feel free to re-take assignment of the issue if it is being actively worked, or if you plan to start that work soon.
